title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 05 March 2015 - XWiki
content:
<vmassol> has quit  
02:42 <debajit> has quit  
02:58 <debajit> has joined #xwiki  
02:59 <debajit> has left #xwiki  
02:59 <debajit> has joined #xwiki  
03:21 <OSIMasson> has quit  
06:02 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
06:04 <Denis> has quit  
07:38 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:47 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:31 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
08:35 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
08:37 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
09:08 <gsmeria> has quit  
09:13 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:21 <woshilapin> has quit  
09:24 <Trefex> has joined #xwiki  
09:24 <Trefex> hello  
09:25 <Trefex> does anybody of you know if it's possible to use xwiki as a document management system  
09:25 <Trefex> with multiple validation steps, versions, etc...  
09:25 <Trefex> for policies, procedures, this kind of thing  
09:38 <vmassol> Trefex: it's possible to have light workflows yes (or integrate with a workflow system)  
09:38 <Trefex> out of the box or using a special plugin?  
09:38 <vmassol> for example http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/XWiki+Publication+Workflow+Application  
09:38 <vmassol> you can cretae your own workflow  
09:38 <vmassol> by adding metadata to pages  
09:39 <vmassol> (and then use script to search/list/etc based on those metadata)  
09:39 <vmassol> (this is what this extension does in practice)  
09:40 <vmassol> so in summary  
09:40 <vmassol> if what you need is some strong workflow feature built in, xwiki is not for you  
09:40 <vmassol> OTOH  
09:40 <vmassol> if what you need is a too to organize content and favor people's contribution and then on the side have some light workflow steps then XWiki is good for that  
09:41 <Trefex> do you know of any enterprise grade open-source workflow systems that integrate well with xwiki ?  
09:41 <Trefex> i mean we will probably use xwiki anyway for normal documentation and wiki purposes  
09:41 <vmassol> Trefex: see http://www.xwiki.com/lang/en/XWikivsOtherSolutions/XWikivsDMS  
09:41 <Trefex> but would be cool to have the workflow either linked or not in yet another system  
09:42 <vmassol> (re XWiki vs DMS)  
09:42 <vmassol> regarding integration there's nothing I know of that already exists so you'll need to perform that integration yourself.  
09:42 <Trefex> vmassol: thanks for the links  
09:42 <vmassol> what I know is that some people have done that in the past with bonita  
09:42 <Trefex> what do you mean by "light" integration in this case?  
09:43 <vmassol> hold on, give me 5 mn  
09:43 <Trefex> yes sure, i'm glad you're helping :)  
09:45 <gdelhumeau> has joined #xwiki  
09:48 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:53 <vmassol> Trefex: I've tried to explain it a bit here: http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/FAQ/Does+XWiki+support+workflows  
09:53 <vmassol> I know it's lacking details but I hope it gives some overview  
09:53 <Trefex> thx a bunch !  
09:54 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
09:56 <vmassol> just added another link that might help Trefex  
09:56 <vmassol> oh I forgot one link too  
09:56 <vmassol> adding  
09:57 <vmassol> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Activiti+Application  
09:58 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:58 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <Trefex> vmassol: real-time updating of doc -> +1 :)  
10:00 <vmassol> :)

14:00 <mflorea> vmassol: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-platform/org.xwiki.platform$xwiki-platform-search-solr-query/993/testReport/junit/org.xwiki.query.solr/SolrQueryExecutorTest/testExecutorRegistration/ seems to be caused by your changed to MockitoOldCoreRule  
14:00 <vmassol> indeed  
14:00 <vmassol> I had run it and it was passing  
14:01 <vmassol> and then I changed again following thomas's comment and I forgot to retest  
14:01 <vmassol> sorry about that, fixing  
14:04 <mflorea> np  
14:09 <vmassol> should be ok now, thanks for noticing

16:29 <vmassol> hmm actually not everything: http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Platform/XWikiCoreResources?action=viewall&language=ko  
16:32 <vmassol> hmm lots of broken here (only 1 doesn't show broken): http://l10n.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/L10N/Search?application=Platform&name=&key=&origtext=&lang=ko&transtext=&status=notdead  
16:33 <vmassol> (not 1 actually, 7)  
16:51 <vmassol> ci.xwiki.org is already slow… :(  
16:54 <vmassol> fixing build bug I introduced

18:44 <Denis1> is now known as <Denis>  
18:45 <Denis> I would like to create a JIRA project for the application-farm-tools contrib project, but seem I do not have enough rights ?  
18:45 <vmassol> Denis: you need to ask in the mail you use to create the github project actually  
18:46 <vmassol> let me do it for you  
18:46 <vmassol> since I've now added a template for that  
18:46 <vmassol> :)  
18:46 <vmassol> github url?  
18:46 <Denis> it was not a new project, a change in name actually, application-farm-import became application-farm-tools  
18:46 <lucaa> has quit  
18:46 <Denis> https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/application-farm-tools  
18:47 <Denis> application-farm-importER  
18:47 <vmassol> shouldn't it be Farm Admin Tools to be // with Admin Tools?  
18:47 <Denis> I am refactoring this apps since it contains other tools in separate sub modules  
18:48 <vmassol> or shoudn't it go in Admin Tools ?  
18:48 <vmassol> different scope?  
18:48 <Denis> I have dedicated a FarmAdmin space  
18:48 <vmassol> yeah seems different  
18:48 <Denis> it is admin tools for farm administrator  
18:49 <vmassol> so should I namethe project "Farm Admin Tools" or "Farm Tools"?  
18:49 <Denis> I am not quite happy see Admin tools as a big mess  
18:49 <vmassol> yup  
18:49 <Denis> actually app-farm-tools contains app-farm-importer and app-farm-updater, and I expect more to come when need arise  
18:50 <vmassol> so should I namethe project "Farm Admin Tools" or "Farm Tools"?  
18:50 <mflorea> has quit  
18:50 <vmassol> (the jira project)  
18:51 <vmassol> waiting :)  
18:51 <vmassol> (I'd like to move on to something else)  
18:52 <Denis> sorry, got interupted, Farm Tools is fine for me  
18:52 <vmassol> ok  
18:53 <vmassol> done  
18:53 <gsmeria> has joined #xwiki  
18:53 <vmassol> http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/FARMTOOLS  
18:53 <vmassol> I love my new template tool :)  
18:54 <vmassol> created a 1.0 version for you

18:54 <vmassol> I love those projects starting at 2.0 :)  
18:54 <Denis> just because 1.x was farm-importer  
18:55 <vmassol> 1.0 was released?  
18:56 <Trefex> has quit  
18:56 <Denis> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Farm+importer  
18:57 <vmassol> have you used alias features in pom for relocation of extension id?  
18:57 <gsmeria> has quit

19:04 <Denis> -ing

19:13 <Denis> in fact, there is an 1.2 never released either :(  
19:13 <Denis> I will add it for consistency
